docs.lead_paragraph: IT started with a phone call. Then the gifts started arriving -- clothes, food, even a wedding ring, left outside the studios of WALK-FM in East Patchogue, along with hundreds of rambling letters. It didn't take long for K.T. Mills, a disc jockey on the afternoon drive-time show on this 50,000-watt station, to realize she had a stalker. Madonna has been stalked. So has Britney Spears. While her star is far from the tinsel of Hollywood, Ms. Mills, a pert, trim 42-year-old with lustrous long hair, has been victimized for the last 10 years by the same fixated listener.

headline.main: Stalked D.J. Triggers Move to Tighten Law
